Reviews.Title: “What a find”
Reviews.Author: MatureAdult
Reviews.Content: Fab location, very helpful staff, gorgeous garden and great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Exotic & beautiful hotel with loads of character”
Reviews.Author: spycygrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empress Zoe the last 2 nights of our honeymoon. We decided to treat ourselves to a suite (since it WAS our honeymoon) and reserved the Chez Zoe Garden Deluxe Suite @ 230EUR/nt. The cab driver had a little trouble finding the place, but we eventually made it & checked in. Our room was in the back building & up a curvy flight of stairs. From Reception, it feels like you are walking with your bag about a mile, but it's really not that far. Much easier when you aren't lugging a suitcase. The room was gorgeous and was actually the size of an apartment. It had a large bedroom with a platform bed and there was also a small single bed in this room. Small window seats and a desk, as well. Really lovely & romantic. The bathroom was the marble hamam shower other people have mentioned. I never entirely figured out what I was supposed to do (other than just take a shower) and the brass faucet over the hamam bowl dripped all the time, meaning I had to scoop out the old, cold water constantly. All of the toiletries are wonderful, however, and I am addicted to the soap (it's this sandlewoody olive soap that makes your skin feel like butter). There was also a front room which had a table & chairs, 2 more single beds/couches & a sink. Plus, there was a small tiled balcony that overlooked the beautiful garden. All rooms have wood floors and are connected by a hallway. The bedroom faced the street and could be a little loud (some fellow was talking on a mobile while revving his moped engine for about 15 minutes), but wasn't too bad. Also, the morning breakfast was wonderful. A good selection of meats, cheese, fruit, yogurt, toast, pastries, etc. and very good coffee. There are afternoon/evening cocktails (for a price) served out of this same area & you can enjoy them in the truly beautiful garden. The garden is one of the best parts. There is a roof deck, as well, but the nights we were there, it was too windy to enjoy for long. Fantastic views, however! I think this hotel is pretty incredible, but the room was far too much, really, for 2 people (unless you were staying a week or something). Especially for 230EUR. However, if you had a family staying there or were traveling with a few friends & you were all sharing the space, it would be a better deal & would make more sense. We really loved ending our trip here, but the other hotel we stayed at in Istanbul was literally a block away and half the price (& very nice). However, I would absolutely return & would recommend this to friends as a unique and beautiful place to enjoy the old city. If you are looking for charm, intimacy & style as opposed to a stark modern hotel, this is certainly the place.

Reviews.Title: “Marvellous authentic beautiful hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: arderne
Reviews.Content: My husband, my daughter, grandaughter and myself stayed here for 3 nights from 19th April for a special 'mini-break'. We arrived late at night and were shown to our room which was absolutely lovely with a hammam style bathroom - table and chairs outside - double bedroom - sort of sitting room with two single beds on stone plinths. It was absolutely perfect - we were all very impressed and happy. The staff were terrific. I would recommend this hotel to anyone - for a party of four - i.e. a couple and two children - I would recommend the Courtyard suite - you could also go out of the courtyard suite straight on to the road if you wished (there were locking doors to which we were given a kay). It really was a wonderful experience, delicious, fresh homemade breakfast etc. etc. We actualy felt dreadful because we were offloaded from our BA flight due to a birdstrike and were told by BA to find our own hotels, meals etc. because there were no hotels available. Everyone at the airport was paniccing. I rang the Empress Zoe and they very kindly offered us a room for three people and to make a bed on the floor. Unfortunately we then found out that my daughter had to work the next day and needed a fast internet connection and her own space etc. etc. and were offered a hotel with 2 rooms a business centre etc. Sadly we, very guiltily, therefore had to suddenly cancel the room (only about ten minutes after booking luckily) and the hotel were extremely kind but I felt very bad about this. Of course, whilst the next hotel offered two rooms and very fast internet it was no where near as wonderful as the Empress Zoe - being a somewhat soulless chain hotel. The staff at Empress Zoe were all terrific and very kind - they responded to all our requests positively and very quickly. The kind of service you would expect from a six star hotel!! Incidentally, there is a perfectly fine internet connection at the Empress Zoe, particularly if you work in the bar or in the lobby but it is a little bit intermittent in the Courtyard Suite. Of course we did not need it particularly on our holiday but due to the cancellation my daughter needed to work throughout most of the day whilst awaiting the flight. On another note, I feel extremely guilty too as, although I gave a small tip on the way in I did not tip the staff on the way out due to the rush - I will recitfy this on my return - if we are allowed back!! All in all I could not possibly recommend a hotel more. Go to the Empress Zoe - it will make your trip to Istanbul perfect and give you the flavour of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “I hope it never changes....”
Reviews.Author: sedoyle
Reviews.Content: i first stayed at the Empress Zoe in 2009 with my daughter for a rainy week in January and i brought my husband back in 2012 for his first trip to Istanbul. It's an amazingly welcoming and individualistic hotel in the middle of swirl of the the Sultanahmet, steps from the Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace. Each room is quite different and reflects the owner's personality and taste. A small family of cats preside over the morning rooms and gardens. Take the warning about stairs seriously, but if you don't mind spiral staircases, it's a dream place with Hamman style bathrooms, riotous colors and delicious lingering breakfasts. We left our luggage for three days while we went to Eastern Turkey and the gracious hostess smiled and kept it safe. Strong shouldered young men carried our bags without a murmer. It has a personality, for sure, and i would imagine that service could be uneven, but we never found it so whether we were having a late night drink or asking for yet another cop of coffee and the mysterious delicious pastry. Below it asks about the swimming pool, and i mistakenly checked it, and i couldn't get it unchecked. there is no swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Stay there once”
Reviews.Author: JohnLosAngeles_CA
Reviews.Content: It's in a great location, although being jolted out of bed every morning by the call to Mecca takes some getting used to. I take that back. I could never get used to that and would definitely find a hotel that isn't so close to a mosque or many mosques. My room was fine. Small, on the top floor of the hotel but one of the staff kindly carried my heavy suitcase up there without being asked. The gentlemen at the front desk were all very friendly, happy to give advice. There is a very nice breakfast served every day but I only made it to the ending of one. I'm used to a more plush hotel so this wasn't exactly the right fit for me, but the other guests all seemed very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: “weird vibe”
Reviews.Author: Mary C
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here last December for four nights. The very warm welcome soon turned sour when I asked if I could get wifi in my room. One of the reception guys blamed my new ipad for having poor reception while the other guy there was very friendly and apologized, fixing it quickly by turning the wifi modem off then on again. To be fair, the grumpy guy apologized later as well... so weird though and unnecessary. The rest of the stay was uneventful... had a great time in Istanbul. However, I returned a couple of weeks later and a nasty woman was on reception. I sat while waiting for the phone calls to finish and listened to her shout at some poor person on the other end. Then she got off the phone and began shouting at the two men who were working with her on reception.. some issue regarding a customer... very mundane and totally unprofessional. I asked if I could have a room for just an afternoon, happy to pay full price, just to have a shower and sort luggage before flying home and she almost barked at me that it would be impossible. I didn't really need to have a room... I was just enquiring... I would never go back to this hotel though... I'm sure there are nicer places and people around Sultanamet... Having said that, thanks to the one guy on the reception who was so sweet and helpful... the one with glasses... sorry you have to work with those hot heads.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: michellebarrett
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little boutique hotel. It's perfectly located, just around the corner from the Four Seasons in the Sultanahmet. The rooms are small, but have very charming features. It's on a great street with lots of restaurant and cafes just outside the front door. They serve a lovely fresh breakfast included in the daily rate. You can walk to many of the important sites such at the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar. The staff are very accommodating. As others have mentioned there is a very steep spiral staircase, but the staff carry your bag to your room, so it's really no problem. It's a good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jmv7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect place to stay in the old city of Istanbul. It is surrounded by very nice restaurants and bars, it is 2 minute walk from Haguia Sophia, and the Topkapi Palace, and it has its own roman palace below it! Not to mention that the rooms are super cozy, and its staff is friendly, and speak good english! Totally recomended!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: horn22
Reviews.Content: We, 2 adults and 2 children, stayed in the Deluxe Suite and loved it! There was enough space for each of us to have our own room. It was comfortable and cozy and had beautiful views. The hotel is lovingly decorated and has a great location. The breakfast was good... though we would have appreciated more variety as the week went on. The staff was very friendly and we would highly recommend staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great character, great location”
Reviews.Author: biophiliac
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times on different visits to Istanbul and have enjoyed it greatly. The stairs are very steep (so be aware), but the staff will handle your luggage for you. (I'm in my 60's and have had no problem at all with the stairs.) This is not a place for people who like standard, 5-star, American-style hotels, but you get much more interesting character (and no sacrifice of comfort). Some rooms are small, but all that I've had have been very comfortable and enjoyable. One of the best things is the breakfast which can be eaten outside in good weather. Great coffee and interesting, varied breakfast items. My single room did not have a TV, but I didn't care about that. It did have good a/c (and I did care). Location is excellent, near the main sights (not near to the Bosphorus River but a nice walk to it.) You can also sit outside at night and have a drink with a great view. I'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A place with character to stay in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: FernandoChamusca
Reviews.Content: This wonderful hotel is situated in Sultanamet very close major atractions in Istambul. All bedrooms has different decoration in turkish style. It has a wonderful garden where you can take breakfast or have a drink with beautiful views over the Bosphorus. Around the hotel we have lots of restaurants where we can eat at reasonable prices. The breakfast is very exclusive, abundant and no standardized.

Reviews.Title: “Astounded. Don't stay anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: mediterraneantraveler
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul for three days, four nights before we got on a boat to go around the mediterranean. On the website, we thought it looked interesting and good for our stay, when we got there, we were immeditely proved wrong, it was much better than that. After the airline forgot our luggage in Frankfurt, we were in a particularly bad mood; but when we got to the hotel that changed. They sent a van just for us to the airport and a friendly man got all our luggage for us. We drove throught the streets until we got to sultanahmet, the old quarter. We walked into the charming lobby with a comfortable sitting area and beautiful art. We were then proceeding to lug our luggage up the little spiral staircase that led up into the hotel, but one of the staff took all four of our bags without even second thought. After we dropped the bags off in our room ( he hadn't even broken a sweat) we got a full tour of the empress Zoe. We were in the deluxe garden suite, on the second level. There were three buildings, the main house, the garden suite building, and a small one with three more modern Mediterranean rooms. There was also an ancient Turkish Hamam (bathhouse) from the ottoman era, adding quite a charm to the whole complex. The garden was astoundingly beautiful, with flowers, trees, herbs, tables, and an assortment of friendly cats. The breakfast, despite what some of the other reviews said, was delicious; and it had a variety of friendly staff to acompany it. There are two decks, one with an amazing view of the sea of mamara, the other with a view over the sea all the way to the galata district, and a view of the haghia sofya. The garden was also a quiet and cool retreat from the busy streets of Istanbul. Our room was amazing, it had a giant marble walk in shower, a room in the back with a double, and two Turkish day beds. The room in the front looked out onto the garden, also with its own deck. It had a kitchenette and a glass table, and another three turkish daybeds ( which also offer a comfortable place to sleep) another enjoyable aspect was the cats, jasper, the patriarch of them all was a regular frequent of our deck, and a kitten, who the toddler daughter of a British family refers to as the "bad kitty". Also, they have the best lemonade in the world at the bar, fresh squeezed, set a new standard for lemonade fit for the gods. It's only available at certain times, but when it is, don't pass it up. Another thing that charmed us about this hotel is how it has it's own personality, none of that run of the mill everyday hotal stuff. Just to add more sunshine to our stay, it was only a dive minute walk from topkapi palace, the haghia sofya, the blue mosque, the basilica cistern, and a fifteen minute walk from the grand bazaar. Also, a little down the street is a restraunt that has a big whole in the wall that leads down to an ancient byzantine roman palace. Also, the staff were the friendliest ever. Another note, please vist Artemis, a little rug and nick nak shop built in to the building. It's run by a man named Joseph and his brother, and they are very friendly. We definitely plan to return this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Royal Location !”
Reviews.Author: sandiphoto
Reviews.Content: Total character, perfectly located to walk to all the attractions , the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and you are right next door practically to the palace with all its lovely park grounds which is not to be missed.We stayed for 4 nights and every night we walked to a different restaurant all except the night on the Bosphorous .They leave you a list of restaurants in your room and they are all amazing ,take the front desks advice they are very friendly! our room had a marbled large bathroom shower traditional hamman it faced the courtyard. loved the breakfasts in the lovely quaint extensive garden courtyard !

Reviews.Title: “Chic Guest House - loved it!”
Reviews.Author: SPAZPATTY
Reviews.Content: My daughters (ages 13 and 11), husband and I spent 3 nights in the Villa Zoe Terrace Suite. Spacious and comfortable with a view of the Sea of Marmara. We loved the location (across from the Four Seasons and walking distance from major must-see sites and great restaurants). Delicious breakfast in cozy dining room. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice for tourists”
Reviews.Author: DavidWorldTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a family trip for five days during early November in this nice little hotel, with three generations, six people altogether. The children liked the alcove beds and also the four poster beds were the adults slept were very comfortable. Our mother had some difficulties climbing the many stairs, but staff was always helpful to open the door on the upper part of the road. The hotel is decorated very nicely and has a beautiful secluded garden through which some of the rooms can be reaches. The location is outstanding, very close to all the interesting sites while a bit on the edge of the fast developing tourist area of Sultanahmet. The breakfast was very good, however, the situation on the breakfast counter was very crammed and it was not so easy to find seating for our larger group, it was not so easy to find place to sit since it too cold to sit outside, which would have allowed for more people to sit. The concierge helped us to find good restaurants. The restaurant choices near the hotel, while decent, are utterly touristic. There are good and more authentic places not far from the hotel. Overall the hotel can clearly be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!!!! Would love to go back”
Reviews.Author: JaNessa G
Reviews.Content: Great location many restaurants on street any room would be good

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pbrennan908
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel a few years ago and also for 3 nights last week. It hasn't changed. The location in Sultanahmed is so convenient to all the sites, to the shopping and to restaurants. Last week I had a room on the ground floor (601) which was on the small side but very quiet; the previous time I had a top floor single with a view to die for. The staff who are wearing their own clothes so to speak (not uniform) - and I find this really relaxing - will go to any lengths to help you (finding me a screwdriver and a ball of string to squeeze my shopping into my bulging suitcase as if it was the most normal thing in the world... Oozing with charm, three gorgeous fat cats sitting in all the most comfortable places (also making it feel like home!), delicious and generous breakfast; the garden must be wonderful in fine weather, it is already lovely in the winter. This hotel is not for you if you are allergic to cats, cant deal with stairs or like uniformed waiters at your elbow. But for me - definitely the place to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Byzantine experience”
Reviews.Author: Helikaon
Reviews.Content: Empress Zoe was an extremely colourful character in Byzantine history and this hotel and it's staff reflect this. The hotel is a one-off small hotel of a completely different style than any other you are likely to see. It has a warm, personal touch you will not find elsewhere. Every room we managed to view had a decent amount of room, an issue in Istanbul. The staff were welcoming, efficient, knowledgeable and very friendly. Their English was impeccable and we enjoyed many a discussion on a variety of topics, from history to food to fashion and politics.. The breakfast comprised basic fresh produce e.g. cheeses, quality tomatoes, fresh bread and delicious home made walnut cake, with great coffee (and tea). My partner who has no sweet tooth, often had two slices of cake! The hotel is positioned at the top of a cobbled street 5 minutes walk from the Hippodrome between the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, so you don't have to travel far to immerse yourself in the history and architecture of this fantastic city. You are effectively at the end of a street of restaurants and small hotels - this is Sultanhamet remember. Staff can advise recommendations if you ask. You can avoid the repetitive entreaties to enter a bar/restaurant etc if you turn left out of reception and left again at the top of the hill. The hotel consists of a main building over four floors and several outbuildings surrounding a covered, walled garden. The main building has no lift so if you are on the 3rd or 4th floors you will have to negotiate a very tight spiral staircase, then further marble stairs. The room views are well worth it. There are some rooms with street access. Be sure to ask before you book, what is available. Invariably costs are higher for the larger more accessible rooms. The garden was a peaceful haven, that I can imagine would be a cool respite from summer heat, it was lovely even in early December when we travelled. There are a few very friendly family cats that add to the homely feel of the place. Please recognise that Zoe is a very individual hotel at the other end of the spectrum from the standard chain hotels that litter most cities. If you want the comfort and character of a very unique place I strongly recommend you stay here. You are only a few minutes walk from Sultanhamet tram stop so access to the city (and Attaturk airport) is easy and cheap by public transport. As this is Sultanhamet you're in a great place for architecture but it will be touristy with all that that means - crowds at weekends, slightly pushy restauranteurs, noisy traffic but get away down back alleys and across the Bosphorus to Asia you are in a different world. Istanbul is a clean, vibrant megalopolis that you really need to visit. Do so and enhance your holiday by staying at the Empress Zoe. Footnote: We were present when the staff received a somewhat odd TA review that seemed to question their attitude. They were literally mortified and one or two almost inconsolable. This indicates the care and pride they put into their work and the lengths they go to to provide great service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityPenelope
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Istanbul, my husband and I weren't quite sure what to expect. It is an amazing city and Hotel Empress Zoe was a delight to return to each evening. The location is perfect. The many cobblestone streets around the hotel were enchanting with lots of restaurants and small shops. The hotel itself is a boutique gem! It was very relaxing. Breakfast was very enjoyable. Excellent yogurt and coffee, fruits and breads. The staff and owners were very welcoming and extremely helpful. If you prefer an impersonal and modern hotel, don't stay here. The Empress exudes warmth.

Reviews.Title: “Zoe has the wow in Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: paddy221666
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a mix of riad and boutique. Price was very reasonable for what you get. The garden is wonderful and full of history itself. The location just couldn't be better. We walked everywhere from Empress Zoe and used the public transit system widely even going to the airport on the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: barbara C
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. Great location. Wonderful breakfasts included. The morning breakfast in their garden courtyard was our place to meet and plan our days. The rooms were very clean and the beds comfy. Perrrrfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: imcarthur
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the penthouse with its wonderful balcony. The room is kind of funky & be prepared for a grueling climb to the room. But the view! The staff was very efficient & the breakfast was good. Remember to budget for cash payment to get the discount.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Empress Zoe”
Reviews.Author: linda M
Reviews.Content: the hotel was absolutely stunning both inside and out. The views are out of this world. The staff were always friendly and very helpful especially Lut who spoke very good English and always seemed to know what we needed and was extremely knowledgeable, also he helped us learn a few Turkish phrases. We would be happy to come back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “I'm in love with Zoe!”
Reviews.Author: Crystalbutterfly
Reviews.Content: The Empress Zoe was my "home" for a week (11/17-11/14) while in Istanbul visiting my son who teaches English there. After reading numerous reviews about the hotel, because mine was spur-of-the-moment trip --I got a great deal on air fare-- I felt most fortunate to secure a last minute reservation. Zoe lived up to her reputation! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the hotel charming, clean, and comfortable with bathrooms in each room. The rates were very, very reasonable. Like many boutique hotels, each room is different, but simply and elegantly decorated (and super clean!). I enjoyed having a view from my room (301) of the Boshporous and windows on two walls. (The view as the sun rose over the water and the morning call to prayer began was, for me, a spiritual experience! And, I'm not Muslim!) If you go, please check out the delightful garden area --an oasis in itself. A healthy, delicious, Turkish breakfast of olives, cheeses, fresh breads, fruit (grapes, pomegranate seeds), jams, tomatoes, cucumbers, hard boiled eggs, juice, tea and coffee was served each day. The smell of coffee wafted up to my room each morning! What a way to start the day! After a full day of walking around the city and seeing the sites, one can expect to come "home" to a bar that is open from 5-11 (staffed by the very profession, personable Suleman) where you can have wine, beer, (or something stronger) while listening to a nice selection of quiet, relaxing jazz music. (Excellent sound system!). Though temps were a bit chilly when I was there having an afternoon evening cocktail or glass of wine in the garden would be nice. Located in Sultanahmet this hotel is conveniently located near the Blue Mosque, the Haga Sophia, the Grand Bazaar (and other sites), public transportation and the ATMS! The only down side is that you have to pass by many interesting and delightful shops selling the incredibly beautiful textiles (think rugs!) and jewelry on your way to get to those places I had the most expensive lunch one day! I went out for lentil soup (delicious all over the city) and came back with a rug and a pair of earrings! I can't wait to return to the enchanting Istanbul and will stay at the Zoe again if there's any room at the inn. C.C.Watkins

Reviews.Title: “Among the best boutiques.”
Reviews.Author: Nick L
Reviews.Content: Built to include the ruins of an ancient hamam, this hotel has some great rooms and is clean, friendly and helpful to tourists. Try and pick your room as some are better than others. Be ready to climb steps.

Reviews.Title: “a lovely old hotel in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: martha1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this lovely hotel in Sultanahmet and found it very comfortable, clean and convenient. We stayed in the newer section in the Garden Suite and later in the Deluxe Garden Suite when it became available. These were quite spacious, with comfortable beds. Although there is no elevator in this hotel, the Garden Suite was actually quite easy to access through the side-door of the hotel which is higher in elevation than the front door, resulting in only one flight of stairs to climb (the Deluxe Suite is on a higher floor and does require more climbing). Breakfast was in the garden, a lovely oasis. The house cats are usually to be found sunning themselves on chairs/benches in the garden. The breakfast is quite adequate. However the selection did not change in the week that we stayed at Empress Zoe and I did find myself wanting more variety. WiFi is available in the garden and lobby but can be a bit iffy. The early morning call to prayer woke me up the first night and seemed to go on for a long time. For whatever reason, this seemed shorter successive nights but maybe I just got used to it! When we closed the bedroom door, the sound was much quieter so I had no trouble sleeping for the rest of the walk. In fact, I quite liked hearing it - added to the ambience. The staff was generally pretty friendly and helpful but not outstandingly so. Certainly they were very responsive to any requests and did help book some things for us. The location is very convenient, close to Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sofya. You do have to walk about 5-10 minutes (depending on your pace) to get to the Sultanahmet tram station or alternatively to the Gulhane tram station but it's not a bad walk. Using the tram, you can pretty much get anywhere easily. The street the hotel faces is full of restaurants. It's hard to walk down the street without waiters pestering you to come into their restaurant. Similarly, you can't avoid the salesmen trying to get you into their stores. However, just walk briskly and it's fine. From our room, you could hear very little noise from the street other than on our first night (a Friday), but it quieted down by 11pm. We were told that staying in the New City would be better because of superior restaurants and an exciting nightlife but we preferred staying here - the majority of sights was within walking distance and we could otherwise easily access transportation to get us elsewhere. This hotel was ideal for all of this.

Reviews.Title: “understated excellence”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: Almost leaning against the wals of Topkapi, the Empress Zoe is perfectly placed for the tourist seeking the old fascinations of Istanbul. The service is helpful, the rooms full of character and the prices reasonable. Even getting the luggage up the tortuously narrow stairway is handled by the staff for you. Breakfast is simple but fresh, and the bar stays open late.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in the one of the world's mega cities”
Reviews.Author: turkbalikadam Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Empress Zoe numerous times. Personally and with my wife. It is excellent for what it is. It has well appointed rooms that are huge by Asian Standards but a bit small for our American cousins. I like them. they are perfect for me. The staircase is a bit narrow for some people, but the team always carry your bag. The mini suites are probably a bit bigger, but for me money is always an issue, so I go for the smallest room. These guys are really nice. Ann is the owner and assisted ably by her sister Tina and they are super hospitable. The team of Turks who do everything in the hotel are brilliant. They are polite and fast and get the job done. But the shining light in this place is Suleyman, the ostensive barman. Read: amateur photographer, eastern Turkish expert and general source of all info with NO STRINGS ATTATCHED. Suleyman is the man to ask for real advice. He's been there for 10 years and does not do BS, Indeed the whole EMZOE does not do BS. Everything is straight and above board. There is an excellent restaurant opposite called KOSK which is superb and has great staff and food, and there is a herbal tea shop facing which has great non alchoholic drinks. The area the EMZOE is based in, is Sultanahmet which is historic in the extreme. Basically in conclusion, if you want a generic room, then stay at the IBIS on kennedy cadessi. If you want a cheap clean room, stay at the moonlight hotel round the corner, but if you want charm, an experience and a wonderful sense of atmosphere at a reasonable price... then you need to stay at the EMZOE. breakfast is stunning, wireless is fast and free

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel close to "old" Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: AustralianVic
Reviews.Content: Empress Zoe is a supurb little hotel with very helpful staff. Quirky/ artistic rooms with reasonable space & great ambience. Great breakfast in a delightful garden setting. It is an oasis of calm in a busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Old Town Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DKB774
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel in the Old City....Great service. They carried our bags up the winding stair case. Garden like setting. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “OMG! What's not to love!”
Reviews.Author: Nellie119
Reviews.Content: Divine. Full of atmosphere and ambience. Very good value for money. Perfect location. Drop dead gorgeous courtyard. Great little breakfasts. Our room was spacious and filled with kilims, brocade fabrics and real timber furniture. Double windows for noise. Good linens. Exemplary service. When we entered we looked at the tiny spiral staircase and back down to our bags, whereupon the receptionist immediately replied that not to worry, they have porters. Wow. I not only intend to stay there again but am telling all my friends, and you!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way”
Reviews.Author: travelingaussie0
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at this fabulous hotel.What can I say?Fabulous location,fabulous staff, fabulous room,fabulous breakfast (though could have had some fresh juice), fabulous private garden oasis...Every morning after a great night's sleep, we had a filling and delicious breakfast, discussed the day's plans with reception staff ,getting detailed directions and suggestions, and headed off into the wonderful city of Istanbul. Exhausted and elated we returned every afternoon to free wifi and the peace of dusk in the garden before setting out for dinner at a restaurant suggested and booked by the morning reception staff. Every day was perfect. I must also mention that I accidently left my prescription sunglasses in the room upon checkout and when I returned home and realized, a quick email correspondence resulted in the glasses arriving home to Australia only 3 days after me! Do not think of staying anywhere else in Istanbul- this is IT!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: agerbras
Reviews.Content: Perfect place to stay right in the middle of Istanbul though quite at night. Rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly. Typecally turkish breakfast, very good and fresh. Owner are very friendly too. So just go for it, at least as long you do not have problems with the staircase, in that case you probably better should choose a different place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stone Bed & Lovely Terrace”
Reviews.Author: Minaseyahi2011
Reviews.Content: we have a lovely rooms from last minute booking, as room was fully booked and we were lucky that some guest cancelled. Our room is room is very authentic turkish style, love the stone bed and lovely terrace face to the sea. Breakfast location is awesone, chill and realx in the garden. Don't expect huge line of food selection but because it seem to be more on Turkish style which only bread, egg, yam and fruit. Overall is awesome experience except sometime staff look stressed....does not smile much....especially night manager......but can understand.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of Istanbul's old city”
Reviews.Author: eb1957
Reviews.Content: Empress Zoe was perfect for our family of five. Unlike conventional big hotels, it is the real deal -- very Turkish without compromising all the traveler's comforts. It is perfectly located near the Blue Mosque and many wonderful local restaurants and transportation. The staff is wonderful and had fabulous dinner suggestions, they even made our reservations for a local turkish bath and tickets to the Cultural Center. The rooms are very clean and lovely, and breakfast on the patio an absolute delight. AND the price is very reasonable. Truly, I can't understand why anyone visiting Istanbul would stay at a place like the Four Seasons (which is right around the corner) when they can stay at the real deal and love it!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: bob j
Reviews.Content: do not stay here< they will steal your money! do not stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and not appealing”
Reviews.Author: wallykNYC
Reviews.Content: we stayed 5 nights here in July and found the "penthouse suite" underwhelming, and the staff indifferent, if not sometimes thuggish. the penthouse suite master bedroom was tiny, just big enuff for the queen bed. We were hoping for a wonderful experience but we were all quite disappointed. The breakfast was well appointed in the garden and the location was relatively close to all the sites in sultanahmet. the web site photos all look nice, but reality is different. If i had to do it again, i would stay in Beyoglu where there is nightlife and locals, and take transit to the touristy spots in Sultanahmet. i am sure you would get better value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good B&B experience”
Reviews.Author: gerrance
Reviews.Content: Delicious breakfast in peaceful garden. The rooftop with a view is a lovely place to relax. I got the "call to prayer" experience I wanted, as the hotel is very near a minaret; but beware: the first call to prayer is at 4:40 in the morning. Convenient to major tourist sites. Outside the hotel, we walked the gauntlet where each restaurant competed aggressively for our business. Overall it conformed to my esthetic requirements of a B&B and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: frugal_travelr
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Empress Zoe. Its a very nice hotel, very close to Hagia Sophia and the staff there was very friendly and helpful. Their courtyard is a peaceful shaded place to sit and relax on a summer afternoon or during breakfast in the morning. We had a room on the side of the building which had creepers on the wall so it blocked a lot of sun and kept it cool during the hot July days. If you are going in winter you might want to ask for a room on the other side.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful oasis”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyLiz
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with the Hotel. The location is perfect for seeing the major attractions. The garden was a welcome relief from the heat of the day. The air conditioning system was not so great in our room, but we did OK anyway. The breakfst was delicious. All of the staff, with one grumpy exception, was very nice and very helpful. If you are going to see the sights, especially the Grand Bazaar, consider hiring Kathy Hamilton of Instanbul personal shopper .com. She gave us an amazing tour and we bought some beautiful things at her special shops. She doesn't take a comission so you can get some great deals! And be sure to eat at Hamdi down by the Spice Market. Fun and delicious!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny - magical!”
Reviews.Author: Sheila_R_11
Reviews.Content: Once I saw the website for this hotel, I knew I wanted to stay here so I did no price comparison. I would gladly spend 120-150 Euro a night again for this. Great location in Sultanahmet (The Old City) within easy walking distance to Hagia Sofia & Blue Mosque, plenty of restaurants nearby. Rooms were beautiful and clean with hearty A/C (a must for Turkey in July!) a well-stocked bar, shady terrace, very friendly staff who spoke excellent English, delicious complimentary breakfast. Our room had a fridge and a safe. Hotel has no elevator though and the steps to the first floor are a steep spiral, so it may not be fully accessible. This hotel alone makes me want to come back to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, Elegant and Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pyrrho
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Empress Zoe for three nights. It is a beautifully decorated and very comfortable hotel. There is a serene, tranquil and cool court yard for breakfast in the mornings and drinks in the evening.There is also a wonderful roof-top sitting area that has gorgeous views over the city and sea. The staff are friendly, polite and very helpful. This is a truly excellent hotel that can be strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: MVTraveler9092
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed this hotel in a fantastic location in Sultanahmet. The staff were friendly and very helpful, the breakfasts were excellent out in their back garden with lots of fresh fruit and home baked breads. The only negative for us was the cramped room with very short, narrow and hard twin beds. I would request a bigger room with bigger beds if they have them available.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdclark123
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, beautiful rooms, delicious food, wonderful terrace garden. In fact, Ive stayed in four star hotels and I would prefer to stay here than the Four Seasons Hotel nearby, and thats saying a lot. It feels very Istanbul, which is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Ottoman elegance - a real delight”
Reviews.Author: Spursgirl01
Reviews.Content: Came across the Empress Zoe Hotel as a recommendation from a friend of a friend. They were fantastically helpful right from the first email, and it continued throughout our stay. The hotel is perfectly situated in the heart of Sultanamet, with all the main attractions only a few minutes walk away. It's beautifully decorated with antique and traditional furniture and furnishings, the rooms are simple, spacious and elegant, the bathrooms are fabulous (and the local soaps etc provided are gorgeous) and the breakfasts (served in their tranquil garden) is a delight. But the real selling point are the staff - nothing was too much trouble - taxis arranged, tables at restaurants booked, computers offered so that we could check in online for our flight home. can't recommend this place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait To Return”
Reviews.Author: divad61
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Empress Zoe for 5 nights, and enjoyed our stay so much. We took the special double room with terrace at 140E, but got a 10% discount for paying Euros cash on arrival. Well worth it. It's a great room. Yes you hear the noise from the tourist strip but we slept right through it. Lasted only until about 1am. The hotel is at the end of a wonderfully tacky tourist street of cafes but the general location to so many attractions more than compensates for that. So many things within walking distance. Nice simple breakfast. Empress Zoe recommends the Albura Kathisma Cafe Restaurant in the tourist street, and it was very good. Food was average at 2 other places we tried there. Above all, the Empress Zoe staff are great, especially Anil, who was so helpful. Great advice for restaurants, best things to do etc. Can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: leslieh33
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 8 nights in May 2011 with 2 other couples. We loved the location in that you could walk to many of the historic sites. The courtyard where you could have breakfast and drinks after site seeing was a perfect way to feel out of the city. The staff was very friendly and helpful, they led us to 2 of our favorite restaurants in the neighborhood. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A feast for history buffs .”
Reviews.Author: Sydneysider70
Reviews.Content: Hotel Empress Zoe is perfectly located in the heart of historic Istanbul. A gorgeous boutique hotel with a fabulous courtyard to escape to hustle and bustle of Istanbul. We were really impressed by the historic items laying around the gardens as though just dug up from antiquity. The hotel is located close to all the famous sites and, if you don't wish to eat at the hotel, there were plenty of restaurants in the surrounding streets. We enjoyed our stay there, but did change rooms. The historic room in the main building. while charming, was just a tad cramped for two adults and a child. The new apartment style room we moved too was so much better, albeit for a higher price. Narrow stair wells didn't worry us, but may affect the less mobile. The staff were always friendly, helpful and enjoyed chatting to the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Characterful boutique hotel in splendid location”
Reviews.Author: XXXAsia
Reviews.Content: We spent a few nights in the Penthouse Suite (Rm 401) which was wonderful & well recommended if you can get it - great view over the Bosphorus, small private terrace, and plenty of space. Well worth the 220 Euros a night and 4 flights of stairs up there. However not all rooms are the same - unfortunately the penthouse gets booked up months ahead so we had to spend our final night in a 'standard room' which was small, dark and backed onto a noisy street. The hotel has some major pluses: +free Wifi (albeit a little sporadic and slow at times, and not accessible in all the rooms) +extremely friendly & helpful staff +TVs with BBC/CNN, fridges and A/C in all rooms. +lovely marble shower rooms ++++ Location - easy stroll to major sights & views from top terrace to Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia. A major plus. The hotel provides breakfast only, and evening bar. However many restaurants are around, though most are very touristy/poor value for money and not greatest food. Well worth taking the tram from Sultanhamet (easy to navigate) down to the Bosphorus or across the bridge to find better restaurants & bars. As other travellers have found, this hotel is not for those who can't manage stairs (no lifts), allergic to cats or light sleepers. The early morning muezzin is very loud, though we mostly slept through it with the aid of earplugs and raki!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and vibe”
Reviews.Author: Toby_Frith
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Empress Zoe will be remembered above all for the three resident cats, including their delightful new kitten. Feline love aside, both of us thought that it was the perfect place for any first-time visit to this wonderful city. The location is superb, tucked away behind the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, with easy access to all of them. Although itâ€™s not the easiest hotel in the world for access (difficult if you are in a wheelchair), the building has a lot of charm and if the weather had been better, we would have taken full advantage of the delightful courtyard. The breakfasts were lovely and really set up us for the day and in the evening there was an informal atmosphere with a number of friendly guests. The staff were tremendously helpful as well. If we do return, then weâ€™d choose a different room to our Honeymoon suite as it was too close to the street, although the Hamann style Shower room was a delight. For those not used to the Call to Prayer, be warned that itâ€™s very loud (as the Blue Mosque is literally a stoneâ€™s throw away) at 5.30 in the morning. I would also recommend not eating in Sultanahmet and trying Beyoglu instead (accessible by tram) Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pension with character/clean/excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sbhoward
Reviews.Content: We LOVED the Empress Zoe - lots of character, clean, comfortable, excellent location in the old town for all the major sights. Breakfast was very good. The service was excellent. We had a problem with our car to the airport - the house manager on that morning, found us a taxi & paid for it (and said I'll work it out for you). The car service they had hired for us didn't show up. He said - that is not the kind of service we provide, we are so sorry & fixed it with out a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique establishment in the heart of Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: nad-mac-deluxe
Reviews.Content: Empress Zoe's is gorgeous. Great roof terrace and courtyard; cute and comfy rooms; lovely staff and a great array of domestic cats!! Hands down the best collection of jams at breakfast, all home made. The only downside for me personally is the noise from the streets in the evening but I have had that problem throughout turkey as I am a light sleeper. My sister had no problems with it. Lovely lively hotel- highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: FromBrazil71
Reviews.Content: As Istanbul was our first stop on our visit to Turkey, we had Empress Zoe arrange to have us met at the airport and driven to the hotel. This went smoothly as did the check in. Our room was of adequate size with a comfortable double bed. The bath was also fine. For sight seeing and restaurants in the Sultanahmet nighborhood, Zoe's location can not be beaten. The staff is most helpful and courteous. The breakfast was hardy. The only drawback is the climb up the stairs of which we had been warned. But that is a small price to pay for a pleasant 4 night stay in this small, intimate, tastefully done hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare yourself for the noisy discos and youth hostels nearby”
Reviews.Author: TMUM15
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderfully furnished and utterly charming, the staff very helpful, the resident cats a real bonus to cat lovers at least (and if you don't like cats, Istanbul may not be the place for you!), buffet breakfast excellent, and the garden a great place to enjoy it. BUT, the hotel does suffer from being too close to the noisy discos and youth hostels on Sultanamet. After our first (sleepless) night there, we mentioned this to the staff, and they said that after a certain hour, it is illegal to make too much noise and they advised us therefore to let staff know after 12 midnight if noise was keeping us awake and they would complain on our behalf, first to the venues making the noise and then to the police. Just thought knowing this might save other travellers from sleepless nights and add to the enjoyment during their stay at this really very special hotel. Also consider asking about the noise when you book. Rooms in the inner courtyard that do not look out over the street as ours did may avoid this noise problem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, friendly staff, and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: S_MARIE22
Reviews.Content: We just ended our stay at Hotel Empress Zoe. We loved the hotel!! Definitely recommend it to any one visiting Istanbul that would like to be near the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, etc. in Sultanahmet. It was a perfect location for our first visit to Istanbul. Two of my friends and I stayed at the hotel for four nights in the Family Room with three separate beds, lots of space, refrigerator, good views, etc. It was very stylish and the staff was really friendly! Airport transfer service was a great help too. I miss Istanbul already!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Teuntravel
Reviews.Content: It has already been a while since I have stayed with Empress, but I just recently signed up for Tripadvisor due to a terrible stay at a different hotel. Experiences at other hotels just make me appreciate the stay I had at Empress Zoe even more. The hotel has a fantastic location in the middle of Istanbul and walking distance from the major tourist attractions. A perfect breakfast, a very cosy garden and we had a beautiful suite for ourselves. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a romantic get-away in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great !!!”
Reviews.Author: ClauSand
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Empress Zoe twice, in the beginning (5 nights) and at the end (3 nights) of our Turkey trip. All the staff was great, the location is perfect, and the room are excellent, specially the garden suite we stayed at first time. Don't worry that much about calling for prayers, sometimes I didn't even waked up with them, other times I heared but come back to sleep... Rooms are warm in winter and have split for summer. We had a great time there ! Full of restaurants and points of interest around.... We also received value tips for our trip from all the staff ! Thank for everything, Empress Zoe!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here”
Reviews.Author: dmp1013
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights in February at the Empress Zoe Hotel and are so glad we did! The first thing it has going for it is its location, in the heart of the Sultanahmet and a stone's throw from most of the major attractions. Then, of course, there is the hotel itself. This is not a luxury hotel. If you want that, stay up the street at the Four Seasons, but I can guarantee you will pay more than the 100 Euros we paid for our suite. That said, we really felt as though we were in Turkey at the Empress Zoe. Think exposed stone, marble Turkish showers big enough to bathe a crowd, kilim-patterned spreads on the beds. There is a beautiful garden that would be wonderful to use in warmer weather, a cute breakfast room that doubles as a bar at night and is a great place to cozy up to a fire with a glass of wine and your laptop. (Internet is free but cannot be accessed in the rooms). The rooms were very clean, although our's could have used a fresh coat of paint. The beds were comfortable, and the bathroom large, with plenty of storage for toiletry items. The breakfasts were good, though a little redundant - olives, fruit, breads, cheese, pastries, juice, and good coffee. Lastly, the staff couldn't have been nicer, especially Anil, who went out of his way to be helpful. If we ever get back to Istanbul - and I hope we do - we will stay at the Empress Zoe again.

Reviews.Title: “Empress Zoe Hotel - the best accommodation in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: myhoney089
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 3 different houses at Empress Zoe during our 2 weeks in Istanbul and we can speak highly of them all. The beds are incredibly comfortable; the windows open; there is always hot water (unlike many hotels in Turkey in Winter); the water pressure is great; the rooms are spotlessly clean; breakfasts are magnificent and plentiful; coffee is the best in Istanbul and the local wines at their bar are excellent. The owners and the staff are exceptional and are on duty 24 hours a day. The central dining room with an open fire is surrounded by little nooks with tables where people from all over the world congregate for a wine or coffee at any time of day or night. You could never be lonely in this hotel. It's like being part of a big family. - Gaye & Dennis, Melbourne, Australia

Reviews.Title: “Individual Hotel, Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: skr_11
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Empress Zoe, and spent 2 nights there. I arrived much later than planned and needed to leave early each morning, so wasn't able to sample the excellent breakfast that other reviewers mention. Having said that, a pack-up breakfast was prepared for me each evening and left in the fridge in the room, so I didn't leave hungry. Plenty of suggestions for dining out and also where to find the best Baklava and Lokum (Turkish Delight). The bar looked inviting with its open fire but again, I wasn't able to spend time in it. Maybe next time when I can plan my travelling better.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a character”
Reviews.Author: AngliA21
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is so special that I never wanted to stay in a chain hotels in this city. Empress Zoe was a perfect match for the mood - small hotel with a character and personality, clean, nice breakfast and perfect-perfect location. Very nice hotel team - professional yet with a true hospitality that you always expect in Turkey but not always find. Very good place to stay, absolutely charming - with kilim covered beds, hidden nice garden and views of the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is so lovely I didn't mind the unpleasant reception staff”
Reviews.Author: chicagogirl22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small, intimate, and charming. My husband and I visited Istanbul, Bodrum, and Cappdocia. Our other hotels were 5 stars, but this inexpensive gem was the most memorable one of my trip. As a first time visitor to Istanbul, I loved the location in the middle of Sultanahmet. The noise and bustle and crowds and energy is great. If you need perfect peace and quiet, then why leave home? Or just go sit on a beach in Florida? World travel is for people who don't mind making a few adjustments. Even though I made reservations 8 months in advance, they only had the smallest room available. Not a problem. The room was clean, comfortable, and attractive. The bathroom and shower was very nice. Be warned- the call to prayer comes through loud and clear at 5 am. I'm not a light sleeper, so it didn't bother me. Breakfast is simple, but delicious, and the terrace is a beautiful place to eat and have a drink in the evening. The hotel bar charges exactly what bars in the neighborhood do for drinks, unlike most hotels which charge double what you'd pay elsewhere. The only complaint I have was the reception staff, who I found to be cold, rude and disdainful. My husband and I look much younger than we are, so maybe they thought we were college kids? Not that that's an excuse. I'm laid back about that stuff, so it didn't bother me, but more sensitive, demanding types should be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: ShellInverloch
Reviews.Content: Great location, amazing hotel. Ancient Hamam next door. Mosque metres aways so the wonderful call to prayer wakes you early. Wonderful building, every room different as not purpose built. Windy narrow staircases. Breakfast garden- all great. Our room lovely- very small balcony, comfy bed. Our only disappointment were the staff- 2 so friendly the others very condescending - we felt like we were there as a favour! But do go and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay; great value”
Reviews.Author: 1travelMD
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed nine days at the Empress Zoe, including three with our adult children. Our experience was wonderful. The hotel is very well situated for seeing Istanbul as it is an easy walk to many sights as well as the tram. We valued a uniquely Turkish hotel rather than a sterile environment. Our rooms were comfortable and spacious. Breakfast choices were abundant, high quality and tasty. Good weather allowed us to begin each day in the lovely garden. The staff was helpful, cheerful and provided excellent advice about restaurants and activities. Can't imagine returning to Istanbul and staying anyplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Empress Zoe - a perfect base for a city vacation trip”
Reviews.Author: NLemon
Reviews.Content: Arriving on Wednesday afternoon was easy due to the pre-ordered airport shuttle service. The problem that our luggage got stuck in Zurich for one day was nothing the hotel could do about. The hotel personal was very kind and service minded and we found ourselves quickly in our nice suite that would be our welcoming base until departure on Sunday afternoon. The breakfasts was also special with for example potato omelette served from 8 o'clock, perfectly preparing us for a day of exciting exploration. When we return to Istanbul again, Empress Zoe will be our preferable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Empress Zoe gives Authentic Istanbul Experience”
Reviews.Author: littlesarahb
Reviews.Content: When I was looking for a hotel in Istanbul, I wanted something that felt Turkish and not a Marriot/4 Seasons/Chain Hotel that just happened to be in Istanbul. I loved the photos of it on the website and it did not disappoint in person. The location was fabulous. Right on White Mustache St (?) which was a nice mostly pedestrian streets with restaurants. We wandered out and ate at one our first night and sat outside and people watched. It was great. It was a short short walk to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Bazaar, etc. The hotel also gave us a good reccomendation for dinner which we really liked too. And after walking by the corner "Turkist Pizza Place" every day across the side street on the corner, we finally went in and had a good simple meal with great service. Breakfast was absolutely perfect in the peaceful courtyard with a nice selection of pastries, fruit, etc. Every night after dinner we bought a bottle of wine at the bar and took it up to the rooftop to watch the sunset or stars. Heaven! It was very hot while we were there and our room's AC unit was working OT dripping water on the floor and not working so well. So, we had to sleep with the widows open and be awoken before dawn with the call to prayer which was right outside our window. Would I have liked more sleep? Yes, but hearing it was part of the experience of travelling there so we didn't mind too much. If I had to get up for work the next day it would be a different story! Staff was very helpful yet not intrusive. Loved the look and feel of the place. Would highly reccomend and wish that I could go back tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Not for me”
Reviews.Author: keduf
Reviews.Content: After staying across the road at the Alaturka the previous week, on my return to Istanbul a friend suggested staying at the Empress Zoe as it had great reviews and looked really nice from the outside.. Unfortunately, I can't say I loved the place...My single room (room 203) was tiny...all it had was a bed jammed into one end - no tv/fridge...Was also very noisy..After checking in I was really disappointed and wishing I'd gone back to the Alaturka which I really couldn't fault, was 10euro cheaper, had much larger rooms and a fridge and TV.. At about 3am I needed to make an urgent call to Australia and dialled 9 to get an outside line with no success...I called reception and was told that 2 days prior there was a lightning strike which created a fault with the lines, so the only option was to buy a phone card and use a public phone..which is not possible in Sultanahmet at 3am as there is nothing open!!! Would have been nice to have been informed about this upon checking in..Can't comment on the breakfast as I checked out at 4.30am..Personally, I just found it overpriced and over rated and definitely won't be going back there!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Comfortable and Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mer772
Reviews.Content: We stayed all over Turkey and this has to be the best overal in value, comfort and class. The artistic elements throughout the hotel with the little attention to details make Empress Zoe superb! We cannot say enough and the value for what you get as compared to the price and selection in other hotels is superior! We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Small Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Doxielvr
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent 4 nights in the Empress Zoe at the end of September 2010. This was a repeat visit for me, after 4 years, and it felt like coming home. The owner, Anne has done a marvelous job in creating an urban oasis. The staff were always helpful and the kitties are an added bonus. We especially enjoyed our time spent in the garden.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location; Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Peter142
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. The Hotel is perfctly located. Close to all of the major attractions, good restaurants nearrby and close to the tram system which is a great way to get around. The staff were fantastic. They are knowledgable and helpful. Gave us great tips for restaurants and especially carpet shopping!! Will go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “the perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bfs16
Reviews.Content: My nineteen year old daughter and I stayed here at the beginning of a Turkish adventure. We stayed in the main buidling at the top of the spiral staircase with a patio. Comfortable room, quiet, cool, and we loved the garden for breakfast. The staff was so friendly and helpful.. I wanted to see a Turkish basketball game and they searched until they found one for me.

Reviews.Title: “A true Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: GAJeepGrrl
Reviews.Content: Located a stone's throw from the gates of Topkapi, Haiga Sophia and the Blue Mosque, the Empress Zoe seemed a logical choice for our whirlwind tour of Istanbul's European side. However, the list of reasons for choosing the hotel quickly grew; among them: 1. The room was clean, comfortable and palatial by European standards. 2. The staff, from the gentleman who carried our bags, to the manager, were warm, courteous and professional, even when I overheard a gentleman provide some "constructive criticism" to one of the desk clerks. 3. Whenever we had a question, the front desk clerks were knowledgeable and accurate. We had questions about ferry times, dinner reservations, and where the post office was located. In every instance, we did not get lost, and the projected trip times were accurate. 4. When my husband forgot our camera in the back of our taxi, the staff took over, and the camera caught up to us in Izmir, two days later. For us, with only two days in town, service and location were so important. The staff at the Empress Zoe make that hotel a bargain at double the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsBen
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our time in Istanbul at Empress Zoe and really appreciated the beautiful garden and the roof terraces. Also the breakfasts were amazing with so many delicious options that it was almost a problem deciding what to have each morning. However we did wish we had chosen one of the rooms on the upper floors as the first floor room had a very small window. Nonetheless a very well positioned, comfortable and friendly hotel with excellent service. Perhaps we will have one of the top floor rooms on another holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Thai_Rain
Reviews.Content: We stayed in at the Empress Zoe in November last year (I'm in the middle of catching up with my reviews :) and found it totally charming. Perfectly positioned in Sultanamet, within walking distance to all the major sightseeing attractions such as The Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace etc... The hotel rooms are unique and nicely decorated. We had a sea view room with balcony small ornamental fireplace. Our room was not big by any standard but as it is so wonderfully decorated and furnished with a very comfortable bed - you just can't help but relax. Outside there is a wonderful courtyard where one can read in quiet privacy away from everything touristy which awaits just outside the door. There is also wonderful history to explore in and around the hotel. The staff are nice and friendly (I believe the hotel is owned by a Canadian, but the staff are local) and there is a small bar inside to wile away the evening if all your day's exploring has worn your legs down :) I would thoroughly recommend this hotel for position, ambiance, friendliness, and above all, relaxing. The only drawback is it has no elevator, so if a spiral staircase is out of the question you need to ask for a downstairs room - other than that; perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Staying at The Empress Zoe was a great experience.”
Reviews.Author: T1RSD
Reviews.Content: We were stranded in Istanbul for an extra 9 days due to the volcanic ash cloud that closed UK airports, we moved to the Empress Zoe for 7 nights and could not be more complementry about any hotel in which we have stayed, all the staff were particularly helpful. The breakfasts were great and from 8-11 am which really suited us. We loved the room, the garden and the evening bar service.

Reviews.Title: “The Comfort and Style of Empress Zoe”
Reviews.Author: ToryT
Reviews.Content: I had read a few good reviews of Empress Zoe and heard good things from members of a reading group I belong to so I knew I wanted to stay here. In the interest of making our money last as long as possible, my mother & I rented a very small room w/ two twin beds. It was a little like a forgotten corner w/ strange angles & it was magnificent. The beds were comfortable; the windows were covered in vine which provided privacy but allowed a nice view of the goings-on in the street. The neighborhood was charming as were the staff and the courtyard where we had breakfast. In the evenings we would go up on the roof w/ a fantastic view of the Blue Mosque & Hagia Sophia & the Sea of Marmara (I think, I was so turned around--large body of water anyway & gorgeous w/ the seagulls). Due to the lack of options we stayed at a larger hotel in Athens toward the end of our journey & paid much much more for it. That hotel did not come close to besting Empress Zoe in style, comfort, friendliness and atmosphere. I want to revisit Istanbul again and will definitely stay at Empress Zoe!

Reviews.Title: “Several houses grouped around a charming...”
Reviews.Author: Suessmaul
Reviews.Content: Several houses grouped around a charming court yard and garden which makes for a heavenly retreat from buzzing Sultanahmet. Friendly staff. Nice choice of fruit, sweet and salty dishes for breakfast. Room decoration has its charm but could be a bit more refined. Prices/value ratio is fine for the rooms and small suite, but don't book the garden suite if you are only two people (it easily fits four) as for the same price you can find a bit more luxury elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back...”
Reviews.Author: sophia1983
Reviews.Content: empress Zoe is a lovely, charming and comfortable hotel. The staff were very attentive and helpful, the buffet breakfast and delicious coffee was perfect and Istanbul is one of the most incredible cities in the world. Stay at the Empress Zoe and you will not be disappointed - especially if you get the Penthouse Suite, it's wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with perfect location”
Reviews.Author: pam1218
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Empress Zoe. My single room had a great view, and a comfortable bedand. It was so welcoming, I always looked forward to coming back to my room at the end of a long day. The staff was always helpful, and gave me some great recommendations for dinner. The cats were an added bonus

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: indobb
Reviews.Content: Empress Zoe doesn't look like much from outside and the lobby but rooms are amazing. It's an old hammam converted into a hotel and attention to detail for design is great. Breakfast is serve yourself from the bar. Location is very touristy but can't ask for better place to see Aya Sofia area. Loved our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel great location a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: crisjoe
Reviews.Content: nice and charming room decorated in local style, good location, convenient access to tramway, good breakfast. A bit expensive yet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, definately recommendable”
Reviews.Author: ThingsOnTour
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews on this site have captured the key points in our view. The bar (and the bar tender) are a highlight. If you like cats, the house cats are cosy. The location is unbeatable. We stayed in the Family Suite which was fine but would have preferred to have at least one comfortable chair to relax. I also thought the mattress was too soft for my liking so quickly got a stiff back!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, old style lovely rooms, perfect location, warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: kchef
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about our stay in at the Empress Zoe. We had 8 enormous bags to lug and the staff could not have been more gracious in offering to carry each and everyone to our room and back down again. We stayed in the family suite and simply loved it. The staff recommended a wonderful little restaurant for dinner and another for lunch. Everyone from the driver that picked us up from the airport, to the welcome clerk, to the bellmen, to the wonderful bartender went way beyond our expectations. For the price, I couldn't imagine staying at a better place in Sultanhamet. We will be back and will recomend it to friends who pass through Istanbul on their way west and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: VisitorSurrey
Reviews.Content: Really near many of the main sights of Istanbul which is convenient, but a drawback if you want to get away from the tourist throngs (even in December). Having said that the hotel garden is an oasis of tranquility. The staff are great and helpful. We really liked the Penthouse Suite which has views on three sides, and is decorated beautifully. The bed is a small double and rock hard with access on one side, which was our only complaint about an otherwise perfect room.

Reviews.Title: “Good but does not have internet access in rooms”
Reviews.Author: JStarrman
Reviews.Content: Internet access only in breakfast room. Otherwise nice rooms, but small and cramped. No lounge area with comfy chairs. Staff has limited English. Very good location. Nice roo top deck.

Reviews.Title: “Location Near all Major Tourist Sites, but away from non touristy nightlife”
Reviews.Author: striebee
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced hotel in tourist conveient Sultanhamet area, but most of the non-touristy restaurants and bars are a cab ride away and Istanbul traffic can be HORRIBLE. The roof deck was great and breakfast was delicious....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: Hoodpoint
Reviews.Content: Based on friends' recommendations and Tripadvisor reviews, we booked 5 nights at the Empress Zoe at the beginning of our 24-day trip to Turkey. Knowing we would be jet-lagged we opted for the hotel transfer service at 25 Euros and it was money well spent. Check-in was smooth and we liked our room, the Cistern Suite. The call to prayer did not really bother us (but believe me, you will hear it) and we grew to like it. I wore earplugs the first night and then never again. Best things about the Empress Zoe: Breakfast, my favorite of the whole trip, with platters of melon, fabuous breads, eggs, and lots more; the garden, a peaceful and cool refuge after our days out in the scorching sun; the location, perfect for tourists new to Istanbul; and the staff, always friendly and full of suggestions. We had great discussions about Turkey with the bartender every night--very welcome after days spent mainly with other tourists. Least favorite thing: the infamous staircase. Perfectly manageable, but I don't like see-through stairs.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful oasis”
Reviews.Author: ACAkka
Reviews.Content: Although we visited I believe two years ago...a friend asked for a recommendation and I thought I must post for others. My husband was on conference, but we decided to stay in the historic district- what a great choice!! The location is fantastic, accommodations- just lovely...we stayed in the double honeymoon suite with a gorgeous view of Aya Sophia. The staff were extremely helpful and the breakfast was wonderful. I can only imagine how lovely it must be in the warmer weather, as we stayed during a snow storm (unusual for Istanbul). You will not be let down if you stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in a cosy place”
Reviews.Author: tair621
Reviews.Content: We have had a lovely stay at this cosy hotel wich has it is own special ambiance, very clean,located nicely,good staff,room could have been a bit biger but it was done in nice way.

Reviews.Title: “The Empress is getting lazy”
Reviews.Author: freakydna
Reviews.Content: We paid plenty of cash for a nice room with a Turkish bath and were greeted by a cool reception when we found our room wasn't yet ready to check in to in the afternoon. We were told to leave our bags and when we came back after dinner, we found our bags were still there and the new receptionist didn't even know that they were ours - they were just sitting out in the lobby. Better yet, we were told that it'd be easier for us to take the bags as the porter would have to be called in. Well, we didn't end up carrying them and the porter actually didn't take that long to arrive. The room was basic but the bathroom was pretty amazing - ready for a private hamam! We were rudely awoken to the sound of drilling next to our heads and were later told that the city was installing street lights - no apologies or sympathy offered. The garden is beautiful but it feels more like New Mexico rather than Istanbul overall. Quite snobby and not really worth the price. In the ground-zero of tourist town and getting lazy in its old age.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodation with for any empress or emperor”
Reviews.Author: TravellingDuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Empress Zoe from 29th August to 5th September and we loved every minute of our stay. We had arranged a car to pick us up from the airport which went very smoothly. The hotel itself is very unique. It is decorated using local materials in Ottoman style which is part of the charm of the place. Breakfast is served in a lounge area or in a garden which is like a lush oasis in the hot city (during our stay we only ate outside once when it was raining, other days we were fortunate enough to use the garden). The breakfast was basic (tomatoes, cucumber, yoghurt, muesli, orange juice, tea, coffee, grapes, melons, bread, olives, jams..) but everything was fresh and delicious. The lounge area also has a small bar that serves drinks from 5pm to 11pm. We stayed in a standard double room as well as the famous Penthouse Suite. Our double room was small but adequate and really beautiful. It looked on to Akbiyik Caddesi which is full of restaurants. However, noise wasn't an issue for us, I can't remember waking up to the sounds of people. The room had a small fridge (perfect for storing my insulins and snacks) and a very effective AC. The bathroom was very small but it served its purpose. The Penthouse Suite was drop-dead gorgeous. It was roomy, had a slightly more hi-tech AC and a bigger fridge. It also had a small terrace which was adjoined to the bigger roof top terrace. This caused some problems because some of the other guests were peering to our room from the roof top. But that's the guests' fault, not the hotel's. The hamam-styled bathroom was spacious and made showering feel like a special moment, if you can say such a thing! Overall, the Penthouse Suite was very romantic and perfect for our stay because this summer we had our 9th "anniversary". I already hinted to my boyfriend that I wouldn't be sorry to have our honeymoon in a place like that! The staff of Empress Zoe only make this place even more special. Everyone was helpful and friendly and we really couldn't thank them enough. The hotel has a few cats that are very friendly and non-aggressive. One of them became our friend and we were delighted when she came to say goodbye to us on the terrace on the last morning. The stairs will pose a problem for people with severe mobility issues. There are no lifts/elevators and some of the stair are very steep. I have knee problems so I needed to hold onto the railings. It wasn't a problem for us but I can understand that for someone it might be. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants authenticity, great service and immense beauty (and who isn't bothered by steep stairwells).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: antonia208
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by Empress Zoe. The location is great (4 blocks from Hagia Sophia and 4 blocks from Bosphorus). The rooms are clean and comfortable. Really everything about the hotel was great. This is definitely a great hotel for someone looking for a charming boutique hotel instead of a large traditional hotel, for it doesn't have room service or a pool. But it more than makes up for those amenities with charm and great service. My only suggestion for the hotel would be to invest in a computer for guests to use!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, charming hotel with great ambiance”
Reviews.Author: tokyochick
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 days on our honeymoon. We loved it- it is in the perfect location, within walking distance to all the major historical sights of Sultanahmet.
