You can walk to all the major sites or take the ferry to the Asian side. We would definitely stay there again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Rude and Unreliable Receptionists”
Reviews.Author: estebanIstanbul
Reviews.Content: Hotel location and quality are very good. But the attitude of the receptionists towards clients' guests and people calling them by phone was extremely rude and unfriendly. The hotel staff doesn't give a reliable impression at all. I even contacted the hotel owner to ask her to warn the receptionists that the word reception implies hospitality, nort rudeness. Also I would like to warn tourists about purchasing tours from the reception of this hotel. As there are several tour companies in the surroundings you really don't need to buy any services like tours, Turkish bath or Whirling Dervishes Cermony from the reception. The same way ignore the recommendations of the receptionist concerning the carpet shops.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and unusual”
Reviews.Author: rgr_uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Chez Zoe Deluxe Garden suite (one separated bedroom with view of Aghia Sophia with one queen size and one single bed, a Turkish style marble bathroom, an ample living area with 2 single couch beds and balcony with garden views ) What an exceptional room in an amazing hotel. We loved the special architecture and the very warm feeling throughout. Great staff and a wonderful Turkish breakfast made our stay simply amazing.

Reviews.Title: “The Empress Zoe is sublime.”
Reviews.Author: lauramcamis
Reviews.Content: We chose the Empress Zoe largely based on reviews in a guide book and this website. We were rewarded. Welcoming, relaxing, and convenient, it was a home away from home. My husband, two adult children and I stayed in the Garden Terrace Suite. In the mornings we ate a delicious breakfast in the dining area often accompanied by Jasper, an orange cat. In the evening we relaxed with a glass of wine while conversing about our adventures during the day or trolling the internet for new ones. At night we stared at the magical view of Aya Sofia outside our bedroom window. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. Stay at the Empress Zoe, if you go to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “very different”
Reviews.Author: zg
Reviews.Content: we were recommended this hotel & were not dissappointed. Its very unique, different. Staff are very polite & friendly. Hotel has very casual relaxed atmosphere. We stayed in the honeymoon suite, but this was just an odinary room with a nice (hamam) bathroom, room was much smaller than we expected. Bed creaked a lot ! Apart from mezzeun from mosque next door which wakes you up early in the morning,( this can't be helped I'm sure the noise is same for the all of Sultanhamet) due to wooden flooring (very nice) the guys in the room next door will wake you up!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hotel in the historical busy old town”
Reviews.Author: MaxTan
Reviews.Content: Hello, I stayed Summer 2006 at this beautyful romatic Hotel for a long weekend. The breakfast is traditional delicous turkish with lots of love prepared. All staff is very kindly and helpful. You can hear from 3 or 4 mosques praying at 5am at the same time. Frankly i knew this will happend, as 2 biggest historical mosques are very close to the Hotel. I really enjoyed everything. You need to spend time on the top floor. Amazing view over the sea. I would go again ..... This Hotel is to be recommended if you....like to be central and dont mind the city noise, if dont look for a Spa and Wellness Hotel, if you like individual accommodation with an orient flair Best, Max

Reviews.Title: “cute place in very touristy neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: treadlightly
Reviews.Content: The empress zoe is a cute little hotel right in the middle of Sultanahmet, the touristy neighbourhood of Istanbul. It is very convenient to all of the main sights which is good, but it is also totally full of annoying touts due to the touristy nature of the area. The minute you walk outside the hotel they are calling out to you and being really irritating. This is not the hotel's fault of course, and not really that big of a deal in the grand scheme of things. If you are here to be a tourist its a good location but if you're more interested in nightlife, I'd suggest staying in Taksim area, which is where all the nightlife is, and no touts at all as its an area where locals live. It is also easy to take the tram from Taksim back to Sultanahmet when you want to see the touristy attractions. We stayed in the cheapest budget room and it was fine, not as small as other reviews would lead you to believe and very cozy and comfortable. The one thing was the shower was really small, and the curtain would stick to your body when you took a shower which was a bit annoying, but the rest of the bathroom was roomy enough and fine. The budget rooms might not be great for people who like sleeping in though as right next to breakfast area so it gets loud in morning. Breakfast was really good here and that was probably a real highlight of the hotel for us. There was fresh and dried and preserved fruits, yogurt, cheese, sliced vegies, spinach and feta pastries, cereals, breads, and olives. I would recomend it, depending on what your interests in Istanbul are and if you want to stay in the main tourist area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Huuhu
Reviews.Content: We recently spent several days at the Empress Zoe in the Chez Zoe garden and deluxe garden suites. Thoroughly enjoyed the hotel-great beds, pillows, showers, etc. These suites are very roomy with a balconies overlooking the lovely courtyard. Location in Sulhtanahmet cannot be beat as all the major sights are within minutes of the hotel. The Fours Seasons Hotel is across the street. Hotel was booked for the last few days of our stay so we moved to the Ritz-Carlton but much preferred the Empress Zoe for both location and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cruisydoodle
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel in the historic quarter of Istanbul. Collection from the airport is 26 euros (hassle free but expensive). The hotel is a wonderful haven with friendly staff and traditional furnishings. Only downside is the narrow spiral staircase from reception to the 1st floor (tricky with a 20kg suitcase). I was really pleased with my room.. small but very clean with a super comfy bed. Loved the hand made soaps in the bathroom. Bonus is that all the rooms are non smoking. It is pleasant to sit out in the secluded garden for the excellent breakfast. Considering the quality and location a single room for 50 euros a night is exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly little hotel in old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: helenakitt
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this site had convinced me that the Empress Zoe was a good bet - and I was not disappointed. Booking service was efficient. The taxi was there to collect me at the airport as arranged. The hotel was warm and welcoming very early on a cold Sunday. My room, though smallish (but I knew that in advance) was beautifully furnished, with a comfortable bed and a pleasure to spend time in. Breakfasts are excellent. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The location in the shadow of Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque takes some beating. Any down side? The shower was the smallest I have ever seen (though beautiful in marble and plenty hot water) and the stairs are very steep. Not ideal for large people (unless you make sure you have a larger bathroom) or for infirm people who have trouble with stairs. However the hotel is quite honest about all this on the web site - so you do get what you see.

Reviews.Title: “The Empress is adorable”
Reviews.Author: EmmyGillies
Reviews.Content: I have never taken the time to post a travel review before, but feel compelled to do so after our very recent stay at the Empress Zoe Hotel. It is without doubt the most charming hotel we have ever stayed in, the only drawback being that we had to tear ourselves away from the lovely terrace and garden and our view of the boats on the Bosphorus to actually spend time in the city! But then returning to the hotel was such a joy! Everything about our stay there was perfect - the room, the staff, their friendliness and help, the location. We have also stayed at the Four Seasons around the corner but infinitely prefer the Empress Zoe. Should we ever have the opportunuity to return to Istanbul we will not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A dream”
Reviews.Author: rebecca-italy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Empress Zoe in January 2006, I am a frequent and fussy traveller and all I can say about this place is that it's the most charming hotel I've ever stayed at.... Romantic with its cozy lounge, its lovely garden, its breath-taking view of the sea from the top floors of the buildings.... In Moorish style, everything is looked after, the personnel is lovely, breakfast is jummy and everything is just perfect and human-size. only negative point: you won't feel like visiting istanbul given the hotel's beauty...

Reviews.Title: “Long Reign Zoe”
Reviews.Author: Volmad
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a great trip to Istanbul, partly enhanced by our stay at the Empress Zoe. I choose the hotel due to all the responses from Trip Advisor and was actually even more pleased than I thought I would be. First of all, the pictures of the garden don't do it justice to me. It's a true delight. It has different nooks, decorative pots, a water fountain, lush plants, and beautiful lighting at night. As well, the room was even larger and nicer than I thought it might be. The private balcony was a perfect place to enjoy breakfast or a drink at night. Having a view of Hagia Sofia from your bedroom (and shower) window adds to the feel of the experience. The room was spotless, bright, and had all we needed, including cable TV which we ONLY used to watch Turkish pop videos. ;-) Of course any hotel experience is only as good as the people that run the place and the Zoe doesn't disappoint. They were all very helpful, friendly, and efficient. I'd certainly if not only stay there again if I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, lots of character”
Reviews.Author: Travel147
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Empress Zoe. We had a small double on the top floor with a terrace that overlooked the Sea of Marmara. The room was small and lacked TV and minibar, but so charming with it's marble fireplace and frescoed walls. We spent hours on our terrace just watching the sleepy street activity of the Sultanahmet and gazing at the sea. The hotel has a very pleasant garden....a great place to take breakfast or have a drink. The hotel staff was helpful with information and directions. The hotel is also near many restaurants, major sights, and shops. The neighborhood in general is very lowkey and a pleasant place to take a stroll. When booking our Istanbul hotel, we had narrowed it down to Empress Zoe and the Four Seasons. A huge price difference, but we do not shy away from high hotel bills. We ended up choosing EZ because of it's high reviews that mentioned it's charms. I glad we did. I highly recomend this hotel to anyone who can due without a couple of luxuries in replace of lots character.

Reviews.Title: “Atmospheric retreat”
Reviews.Author: C1981
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Empress Zoe from 1-5th September and we had a wonderful time. We stayed in the Petit Suite, which was very small and had a small hamam and a seperate bathroom, a double room and a small single room. We used the small single to store our clothes and cases, leaving the bedroom clutter free. The room was not luxurious but had such atmosphere and it was nice to feel we were still in historic Istanbul when we were back at the hotel. The breakfast was great and the garden was lovely and peaceful and great place to decide what to do with the day. The staff was friendly and helpful. The location was second to none and we found the Saltanahmet distrcit to be a fascinating part of the city and much quieter than other modern areas where many large hotels are located. Highly recommended for tjose who like hotels to be characterful.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Aion
Reviews.Content: Hotel more original rather than convenient. But in it there is a charm. You feel in Turkey. And simultaneously as at home with such lovely and easy owners.

Reviews.Title: “Great little gem in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Kat76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at a fabulous hotel for our honeymoon in Istanbul - Empress Zoe. First of all, the location is superb. It is located in the heart of Sultanamet (the historical area of Istanbul). The hotel is a five minute walk to Topkapi Palace and perhaps a seven to ten minute walk to Ayasofia and the Blue Mosque, not to mention perhaps a 15 to 20 minute walk to the Grand Bazar. Since the hotel is loacted in a touristic area, the only inconvenience is the multitude of locals in the area trying to sell you something or other when you step out of the hotel. The hotel itself is very charming. Decorated in Byzantine style and literaly next to an old Turkish bath, Empress Zoe blends the historical to the contemporary in its decor. The less expensive rooms are a little snug and one musn't mind staying in a hotel with many stairs (it's a historical building after all), but on a whole this hotel is fabulous. You can enjoy breakfast in a beautiful garden with fountains, artefacts and the occasional stray cat that makes a visit. I would highly recommend Empress Zoe.

Reviews.Title: “the garden and roof terrace are lovely”
Reviews.Author: andykeen
Reviews.Content: The price for this hotel is reasonable for its location, and the great feel of the place. We had a very comfortable stay, enjoyed a beer on the roof with a great view of the Bosphorus, were given very good service by the reception, booking a restaurant for us and giving us good advice. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth considering”
Reviews.Author: Smithster100
Reviews.Content: Having spent four nights at the Empress Zoe this July, I have to say this Hotel scores well on the value for money and location stakes. The interior is perhaps not quite the stunning mosiac of ethnic and urban chic that the website and a number of local hotel guides suggest . However, it does seem to depend whether you are in the new or the old house of the hotel. We were in the new house and the main drawback was the labyrinthian interior with no lift (yes, the spiral staircase is an issue if you have a) big cases b) any kind of functional impairement!) That said, the rooms there were well decorated, comfortable & the bathrooms suitably Turkish in their feel. Breakfast was average in terms of its quality - though the setting for breakfast in the small garden courtyard is very attractive. The real reason to stay here is the location - right next to the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia, the Bosphorous is a 10 minute walk and the Grand Bazzar about the same. Cabs in Istanbul are a great low cost option but be warned, the traffic in this city makes most western downtown areas look like a ghost town. Take care using cabs between 9am and 7pm if you are in a hurry!! Overall the Empress Zoe offers good value for money and a great location, certainly well worth considering for a stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: lmmNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a lovely visit to Istanbul. I had booked four nights in the penthouse suite after reading the reviews on this website and other guidebooks. I wanted to stay in a hotel that was charming, but reasonably priced. But when we saw the penthouse room we were very disappointed. The room was a good size and has a double bed in a separate room (around the size of the bed). There are two day beds in the main room and a table. But the room was dumpy, worn and lacked charm. (Our room had ants.) The terrace was the nicest part of the penthouse. I told the hotel clerk that I did not like the room and I wanted to find another hotel to stay at. They told me that they would charge for 1 night (160 Euros) if I left since I didn't give them 24 hours notice. So, I stayed the one night and found a nice hotel a couple blocks away for the remaining three nights. We stayed at Yesil Ev, (for the same price) and I was very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DCMex
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at EZ as it was recommended in the T&L magazine, and although we stayed for one night only, I wish we could have stayed longer. Very nice hotel, our room had a great view to the Aya Sofia. Breakfast was OK. For the price I think we got a very good value for our money. The only complain is the restaurants recommendations they gave us, food was terrible!! Other wise, good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Zzz.... mundane......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Zoe with my boyfriend this fall/winter and i found nothing particularly attractive about this place that has made so many people rave about it in many places. It tries to be special, but nothing out of ordinary. A regular hotel in middle of a beautiful city. A fabulous location, but that is about it. Not really dirty, but "felt" dirty. Felt like an old inn without any of the charm. somehow did not sparkle. Maybe tried too much that the hotel is contrived? Staff is not friendly but not unfriendly either. But they could be more approachable and be more friendly. Wouldn't stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: RCLCOLPB
Reviews.Content: Empress Zoe is in a very convenient location a block from Four Seasons and a couple of blocks from Aya Sofya church and many other Sultanahmet tourist attractions and Topkapi Palace. 85 Euros for standard double less 10% discount for cash/TC, , info@emzoe.com, 212.518.2504 or 212.518.4360, Ann Nevans is owner. A rehabbed Ottoman mansion with below grade lobby, rooftop deck with great views of Bosphorus and back views of Aya Sofya and Blue Mosque, nicely decorated but smallish room (Room 24, with a bathroom and shower that make our small one at home look large). Lots of stairs, including spiral staircase from lobby to second floor. Good AC. No internet service, but many cafes nearby. Good buffet breakfast near fountain in lovely garden. The breakfast included breads, great jams and butter, delicious yogurt, olives, cheeses, fruit/cucumbers/tomatoes, and sometimes a cheese borek (pastry). We opted to be greeted at the airport by a driver from Empress Zoe (26 Euros, less 10% for cash, vs. about 22 YTL for cab). A cab would probably have been fine, and can now take tram from the airport to the end of the line and walk a few blocks to another tram to Sultanahmet (but given how crowded it can be, and the fact that we were pickpocketed on the tram, would probably be concerned about taking it with luggage), so a nice but probably unnecessary luxury relative to cab.

Reviews.Title: “i agree - get the penthouse!”
Reviews.Author: cfelch
Reviews.Content: after staying in the four seasons just around the corner for 6 days, we had to get a room elsewhere for the last night [we missed our flight back home], and the only room they had available was a penthouse suite. after climbing about 4 different sets of circular stairs, we found our room to include two small bedrooms with double beds. one overlooked the AyaSophia, the other overlooked the golden horn and bosphorus. a very nice bathroom as well [no bath, only a nice walk-in marble shower]. then we went upstairs, [another circular stair], to a penthouse, which included a table, kitchenette, and 2 daybeds]. and two rooftop decks, again overlooking the AyaSophia and Golden Horn. the view was spectacular. breakfast is included, and is a very good turkish continental. the staff was very kind and very accommodating. we paid $135 for the night, which was about 1/3 the price of the Four Seasons. one can't compare the two, but for the money, and the view, i'd much rather stay here.

Reviews.Title: “stay in the penthouse!”
Reviews.Author: birdfarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel twice during our trip and enjoyed it very much. We loved the interior and the daily breakfast (oh my god that breakfast!!! we still talk about it!). The staff was very accommodating in general (although the owner got cranky when we decided to cancel the middle part of our reservation in order to tour the countryside, and a stack of postcards I left at the front desk apparently (who knows?) was never mailed). That's back in March 2001, so things may have changed, but one thing that's probably not changed, and that's the size of the rooms. We (1 couple + 1 friend) stayed in some of the regular rooms when we first arrived in Istanbul (sorry, I can't remember more specifics about the type of room) and found our rooms a bit small for the price. When we enquired about larger rooms, we were told that we already had some of the largest rooms in our categories--our friend was told that he actually had a small double for the price of a single! BUT....when we returned to Istanbul, after our tour of other areas, we had spent less money than we had expected, so we decided stay in the penthouse for our last two nights in Turkey. And THAT was wonderful beyond words and seemed a bargain at the price. The penthouse's private rooftop terrace with views of Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, the Sea of Marmara etc. is one of the most delightful spots on earth, and I don't feel I'm exaggerating. If we ever return to Istanbul we will budget to stay in the penthouse the entire time--I don't care if we have to eat pretzels every meal to pay for it. (And because the penthouse has some kitchenette facilities, we really can save money on meals by keeping some food in our room). I suggest you do the same--you won't regret it. I dug up a photo, which I'll try to post, and noticed some peeling paint in the background, but I was too busy looking at the incredible views to notice at the time. So if you're seeking delightful & exotic experience with a perfect location, then you should absolutely stay here. In the penthouse, of course.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed with Empress Zoe”
Reviews.Author: darlingdan
Reviews.Content: Having read so many positive reviews of the the Empress Zoe , I was desperate to spend some of my 5 night stay in Istanbul at this hotel, and jumped at the chance when they offered me a petit suite for one night at the start of the trip. As it was described as suite I expected to have some seating area or at least a chair instead I had what seemed to be a room split in two with 2 beds in one room and a double in the other and nowhere to sit . Not what I needed as a single traveller. Having arrived late I just went straight to bed . Breakfast next morning did nothing to improve my impression of this hotel , the man behind the counter looked like someone who had walked in off the street and had been taught to say tea and coffee and for the most part concentrated on cutting pieces of bread which in the end looked like scraps on a plate . at the same time chatting mainly to another employee who was there helping herself to breakfast leaving most guests to help themselves. The garden where breakfast is taken is very pleasant but again I was slightly irritated by workmen passing in and out through a hole in the the wall gaining access to some building work on the other side . I spent very little time at this hotel but first impressions count and I found this hotel lacking in many areas . I spent a similar amount of time at another hotel in the old town and am hoping to go back and stay for a week next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Azuremeg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in May and absolutely loved it. Great location, five minute walk to everything, very safe. The paintings in the hotel are fabulous and so is the garden where we ate breakfast every morning. I also had a soft spot for the house cat, Jasper, he took a nap in our room one afternoon and we loved it! I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

HotelInfo.Name: Empress Zoe
HotelInfo.Address: Akbiyik Cad. Adliye Sok. No:10 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400, Turkey
